column2: This law determines the ability of the Emperor to be able to usurp non-viceroyal duchies at will.
Imperial usurpation of any non-viceroyal duchies by the emperor is not allowed. The emperor may always return to this.
The emperor may usurp non-viceroyal duchies from a feudal direct vassal for any reason.
The emperor may usurp republic duchies from a republic direct vassal for any reason.
The emperor may usurp theocratic duchies from a theocratic direct vassal for any reason.
Bestow Born In The Purple Law

Born In The Purple is a trait reserved for only direct children of the Emperor who are born in the Imperial Palace. The Emperor may, under certain conditions, grant this trait to grandchildren of the Emperor.
Bestow Born In The Purple Disabled
Born In The Purple may not be bestowed outside of traditional means.
Bestow Born In The Purple Enabled

Born In The Purple is a trait reserved for only direct children of the Emperor who are born in the Imperial Palace. The Emperor may, under certain conditions, grant this trait to grandchildren of the Emperor.
Certain laws pertaining to title decisions within the realm.
The ruler may not deactivate owned titular titles.
The ruler may deactivate owned titular titles.
The ruler may not issue De Jure edicts for vassal titles.
The ruler may issue De Jure edicts for vassal titles.
Strike a blow for freedom everywhere by usurping control over the [This.GetName] Trade Post.
column3: Combattre pour défendre la liberté en usurpant le comptoir de [This.GetName].
column4: Brecht überall eine Lanze für Freiheit, indem Ihr die Kontrolle über den [This.GetName] Handelsposten an Euch reißt.
column6: Contribuir a la defensa de la libertad en todas partes usurpando el control del Puesto Comercial de [This.GetName].

column2: The Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
The Imperial Senate is not active. The Consul title is inactive.
The Imperial Senate is established. The Consul title is now active. Imperial Senate provinces may now be established.
Senators may be appointed from select Imperial provinces. Provinces must be established in turn to appoint Senators from them.
All Imperial Senate provinces are inactive.
The province of Greece is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Epirus is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Sicily is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Italy is established within the Imperial Senate.
Imperial Province of Sardinia and Corsica
The province of Sardinia and Corsica is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Baetica is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Africa is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Trebizond is established within the Imperial Senate.
The province of Anatolia is established within the Imperial Senate.
The Legates Augusti were literally envoys of the Emperor, governors which oversaw a specific province of the Roman Empire.
The Legates Augusti titles are inactive.
The Legates Augusti titles are enabled.
The Legates Augusti are selected from the provincial area to which they belong.
All Legates Augusti provinces are inactive.
The province of Hispania is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Gallia is established within the Legates Augusti.

The province of Egypt is established within the Legates Augusti. After Marcus Antonius was defeated and Octavian rose to power, Egypt would forever be seen as a crucial asset to the Roman Empire, distinguishing it a bit above other Legates Augusti.
The province of Germania is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Britannia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Dalmatia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Moesia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Syria is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Armenia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Arabia is established within the Legates Augusti.
The province of Italia is established within the Legates Augusti.
This law determines the ability of those within the realm to utilize blinding as a punishment for crimes.
Blinding may not be used as a punishment.
Blinding of a single eye may be used as a punishment.
Full blinding may be used as a punishment.
This law determines the ability of those within the realm to utilize castration as a punishment for crimes.
Castration may not be used as a punishment.
Castration may be used as a punishment.
You may give the order to partially blind §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§!.
You may give the order to permanently blind §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§!.
You may give the order to castrate §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! and turn him into a eunuch. He will be unable to sire more spawn or be granted landed titles, a severe punishment.
column3: Vous pourriez donner l'ordre de castrer §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! pour en faire un eunuque. Il serait incapable d'engendrer ou de recevoir des titres. Un sévère châtiment.
column4: Ihr könnt den Befehl zum Kastrieren von §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! erteilen und ihn so in einen Eunuchen verwandeln. Er wird danach nicht länger in der Lage sein Erben zu zeugen oder Besitztümer zu erhalten. Eine wahrlich schwere Strafe.
column6: Puedes ordenar que castren a §Y[Root.GetFirstName]§! y convertirlo en eunuco. No podrá tener más descendencia ni se le concederán títulos con tierras. Un castigo muy duro.

column2: [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is released on conditional 5 year probation. [Root.GetSheHe] will no longer plot against you.
The Council's ability to vote on Class I Punishment decisions - probation, torture, and humiliation.
The Ruler has full authority on Class I punishments.
The Council may vote on Class I punishments.
The Council's ability to influence Class II Punishment decisions - mutilation, blinding, and castration.
The Ruler has full authority on Class II punishments.
The Council may vote on Class II punishments.
Bestow the Born in the Purple trait on §Y[Root.Holder.GetFullName]§!.
This ruler has bestowed the Born in the Purple trait upon a grandchild.
The realm Houndmaster maintains the hunting and guard dogs.
The Tresviri Capitales are a council of three which manage the carrying out of executions in the Byzantine Empire.
The Tresviri Epulones are a council of three priests which manage public banquets in the Byzantine Empire.
The Tresviri Monetales are a council of three which manage the minting of coins in the Byzantine Empire.

The Consul was a member of the Imperial Senate, often appointed by the Emperor, to oversee Senate proceedings with the Emperor, and to see to the Senate on the Emperor's behalf. While in real life there were two, in game the Emperor is limited to one.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
Senators of the Imperial Senate of the Roman Empire handled many of the laws regarding the operation of the Empire, advising the Emperor and offering counsel.
The Legatus Hispania is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Hispania.
The Legatus Gallia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Gallia.

The Praefectus Aegyptus is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Aegyptus. It is similar to a Legatus Augusti title, but is a higher honor. After Marcus Antonius was defeated and Octavian rose to power, Egypt would forever be seen as a crucial asset to the Roman Empire.
The Legatus Germania is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Germania.
The Legatus Britannia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Britannia.
The Legatus Dalmatia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Dalmatia.
The Legatus Moesia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Moesia.
The Legatus Syria is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Syria.
The Legatus Armenia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Armenia.
The Legatus Arabia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Arabia.
The Legatus Italia is the governor which oversees the imperial province of Italia.
The ruler has proclaimed an edict, shifting the de jure allegiance of a vassal.
